_header: I am Rose woe is me
_description: A woman’s lament — four short lines translating Latin version preceding, heu iii qui rosa…

CULHh611.Transcription:
I am Rose wo is mesutere kat ignete þeþat i wacs
                    þat weylaweycherles hand me þristet ay
CULHh611.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 233.
Barratt,  Alexandra. 
             “‘I am Rose’ Restored.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 37 [235] (1990): 270: 270.
